name: Float My Icon
author: John Zhang

sections.description:
This plugin makes it easy to create floating icons at your website. You can easily customize the icon and position of the icon from within the settings. There’s also a fancy preview section within the settings so you can see your changes before you save them.

1.0.0

  • First Version.

1.0.0

  • First Version.
sections.installation:
From your WordPress dashboard

  1. Visit ‘Plugins > Add New’.
  2. Search for ‘Float My Icon’.
  3. Activate ‘Float My Icon’ from your Plugins page.
  4. Visit ‘Float My Icon’ in the sidebar to create floating icons.

From WordPress.org

  1. Download ‘Float My Icon’.
  2. Upload the ‘float-my-icon’ directory to your ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory, using your favorite method (ftp, sftp, scp, etc…).
  3. Activate ‘Float My Icon’ from your Plugins page.
  4. Visit ‘Float My Icon’ in the sidebar to create floating icons.
sections.faq:
Does the plugin support mobile device?

The plugin has poorly implemented mobile support. You can turn off the mobile display through setting.

short_description: Easily create floating icons at your website. Use its capabilities to place unique sidebar on the site.
